revised_title: Observations on Horizontal Refraction and its Impact on Nautical Observations
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, discusses his observations on the quantity of horizontal refraction and presents a method for measuring the dip at sea. He explains that variations in the dip of the apparent horizon, which affect all observations of altitude at sea, can be influenced by this variable refraction. Wollaston also suggests a way to correct the error in nautical observations caused by assuming the horizon is always at the observer's height.
